page.title: 04THE LANES
page.content:
Other than a few stretches of B class roads that lead to Totnes or Plymouth, most of the travelling ways are Devon lanes.
They are typical of this part of Devon and are narrow;usually no more that 3 metres at their widest.Most are have steep sided banks that are,in summer,maybe 3 metres high with growth.
From early April they begin to crowd with growth.First the Primroses and the Campions and then through the summer a succession of foxgloves, ferns, shrubs and grasses. Luckily,farmers still value them and the wildlife they shelter.
For cars there are worn passing places but locals learn how to reverse well.
